      Creates an empty pot with a default whitelist of allowed ingredient categories

      public Pot(Set<Ingredient.Category> allowedCategories)

      Parameters:
      allowedCategories - the set of allowed ingredient categories

  • Method Details

    • canAccept

      public boolean canAccept(Ingredient ingredient)
      Checks whether the given ingredient can be added to the pot according to the whitelist
      Parameters:
      ingredient - the ingredient to check
      Returns:
      true if the ingredient is allowed, false otherwite

    • addIngredient

      public boolean addIngredient(Ingredient ingredient)
      Checks whether the given ingredient can be added to the pot and then adds it if it can
      Parameters:
      ingredient - the ingredient to check
      Returns:
      true if the ingredient is allowed, false otherwite

    • brewPotion

      public void brewPotion()
      Checks whether the potion can be brewed or not and makes it if possible
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if potion creation fails.

    • flipPot

      public void flipPot()
      Resets the ingredients in the pot and empties the pot itself at the same time.

    • drinkADose

      public boolean drinkADose()
      Drinks a single dose from the pot. Decreases the number of doses by one and prints the remaining amount.
      Returns:
      true if the dose was consumed, false if the pot is empty

    • drinkWhole

      public boolean drinkWhole()
      Drinks an entire pot worth of potion. This consumes dosesPerPot doses at once.
      Returns:
      true if a full pot could be consumed, false if not enough doses are available

    • addDose

      public void addDose(int dose)
      Adds a given number of doses to the pot.
      Parameters:
      dose - the amount of doses to add

    • refill

      public void refill()
      Refills the pot back to the default capacity.

    • getnbDoses

      public int getnbDoses()
      Returns the current number of remaining doses.
      Returns:
      the number of doses

    • getDosesPerPot

      public int getDosesPerPot()
      Returns the number of doses contained in one full pot.
      Returns:
      the current number of doses

    • hasAtLeast

      public boolean hasAtLeast(int required)
      Checks whether the pot contains at least the required number of doses.
      Parameters:
      required - the minimum number of doses needed
      Returns:
      true if the pot has at least the given amount, false otherwise

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the pot is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the number of doses is 0 or less, false otherwise

      public MagicPotion getMagicPotion()
      Returns the magic potion
